protocol_name: Northen blotting with DIG Northern Starter Kit (Roche®)
protocol_name_html: Northen blotting with DIG Northern Starter Kit (Roche®)
description: This script is used for northern blotting with the Roche DIG Northern Starter Kit.

sub_authors.affiliation: Institute of Synthetic Microbiology, Heinrich Heine University Düsseldorf

components.data:
Producing 5S RNA hybridization probe:

 

 

Primer:

TCTTGGTGTCTTTAGCGTCATGGAAC (#460_5S_6803_fw)

TAATACGACTCACTATAGGGACTTGGCATCGGACATTGTGC (#461_T7_5S_6803_rev)

 

PCR reaction mix:  
5x Q5 Reaction buffer 10 µL
10 mM dNTPs 1 µL
10 µM forward Primer 2.5 µL
10 µM revers Primer 2.5 µL
template DNA 1 µL
Q5 polymerase 0.5 µL
H2O ad 50 µL

 

PCR setup:   Anneal at 71°C
1 98°C 30 sec
Loop 30x    
2 98°C 5 sec
3 71°C 15 sec
4 72°C 15 sec
end of Loop    
5 72°C 2 min
6 4°C 10 sec
components.name: Description

components.data:
Clean glasplates, spacer and combs with 70% EtOH and RNase Away. Assemble gelchamber in casting frame.

 

Gel mixture for 10 mL:

 

8% PAA gel:  
40% PAA (19:1) Rotipage (Roth) 2 mL
Urea 5 g
10x TBE 1 mL
H2O ad 10 mL
   
10x APS 100 µL
TEMED 10 µL

 

Pour gel and let polymerize at least 2 h at roomtemperature.
components.name: Description

Pour gel and let polymerize at least 2 h at roomtemperature.

components.data: Preparation of denaturating 8% PAA gels
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare RNA-probes:

 

  • Use 3 µg of previously extracted RNA (see mentioned protocol) and aquibrilate probes on same level with DEPC-treated H2O and add 2x RNA loadingbuffer (Thermofisher).
  • Prepare mixture of 4 µL high range ladder and 2x RNA loadingbuffer (Thermofisher).
  • Denature probes and ladder for  5 min at 95°C and rapidly cool down on ice.
  • Load gel and let it run at 25 mA in 1% TBE buffer.
components.name: Description

Prepare RNA-probes:

  • Prepare mixture of 4 µL high range ladder and 2x RNA loadingbuffer (Thermofisher).
  • Denature probes and ladder for  5 min at 95°C and rapidly cool down on ice.
  • Load gel and let it run at 25 mA in 1% TBE buffer.

source_data.description:
This protocol is used for RNA extraction in cyanobacteria after Pinto et al. 2009.

 

Pinto, Fernando Lopes; Thapper, Anders; Sontheim, Wolfgang; Lindblad, Peter (2009): Analysis of current and alternative phenol based RNA extraction methodologies for cyanobacteria. In: BMC molecular biology 10, S. 79. DOI: 10.1186/1471-2199-10-79 .
source_data.warning:
Additional Information

Always provide RNA work on ice and always wear Gloves.

 

 

GHS Label elements, including precautionary statements

                                              

Signal word                 Danger

Hazard statement(s)

H227                           Combustible liquid.

H302                           Harmful if swallowed.

H319                           Causes serious eye irritation.

H311                           Toxic in contact with skin.

H314                           Causes severe skin burns and eye damage.

H330                           Fatal if inhaled.

H341                           Suspected of causing genetic defects.

H371                           May cause damage to organs.

H373                           May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure.

H402                           Harmful to aquatic life.

Precaution Statement(s)

P260                           Do not breathe dust/ fume/ gas/ mist/ vapours/ spray.

P280                           Wear protective gloves/ protective clothing/ eye protection/ face protection.

P284                           Wear respiratory protection.

P305 + P351 + P338 IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing.

P310                           Immediately call a POISON CENTER or doctor/ physician.

components.data: Centrifuge for 3 minutes at 4˚C and 4.000 g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 3 minutes at 4˚C and 4.000 g.

components.data: Resuspend the cell pellet in 1 ml of PGTX. Freeze in liquid nitrogen and store at -20 ˚C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cell pellet in 1 ml of PGTX. Freeze in liquid nitrogen and store at -20 ˚C.

source_data.body: Wear goggles, a lab coat and gloves when dealing with PGTX and liquid nitrogen.

components.data: Incubate for 5 min at 95 °C, shaking at 250 rpm in Thermomixer (Eppendorf)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for 5 min at 95 °C, shaking at 250 rpm in Thermomixer (Eppendorf)

components.data: Rapidly chill 5 min on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rapidly chill 5 min on ice.

components.data: Add 700 µl Chloroform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 700 µl Chloroform.

source_data.body: Wear goggles, a lab coat and gloves when dealing with phenol and chloroform.

components.data: Let the samples incubate for 10 min at room temperature in a Thermomixer. Vortex from time to time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the samples incubate for 10 min at room temperature in a Thermomixer. Vortex from time to time.

components.data: Centrifuge for 15 min at 14.000 g, 4 ˚C. Transfer the upper aqueous phase (contains RNA) to a fresh reaction tube and add the same volume (450 µL) of Aqua- P/C/I (Phenol/Chloroform/Isoamylalcohol).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 15 min at 14.000 g, 4 ˚C. Transfer the upper aqueous phase (contains RNA) to a fresh reaction tube and add the same volume (450 µL) of Aqua- P/C/I (Phenol/Chloroform/Isoamylalcohol).

source_data.body: Wear goggles, a lab coat and gloves when dealing with phenol and chloroform.

components.data: Thoroughly mix by vortexing. Centrifuge for 15 min at high speed. Transfer the upper aqueous phase to a 1.5 mL reaction tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thoroughly mix by vortexing. Centrifuge for 15 min at high speed. Transfer the upper aqueous phase to a 1.5 mL reaction tube.

source_data.body: Wear goggles, a lab coat and gloves when dealing with phenol and chloroform.

components.data: Add 1 volume of isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 volume of isopropanol.

components.data: Mix and incubate for at least 30 min at -20 ˚C. (Can be left overnight.)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix and incubate for at least 30 min at -20 ˚C. (Can be left overnight.)

components.data: Centrifuge at 14.000 g for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 14.000 g for 30 min.

components.data: Wash with 75% chilled ethanol. Avoid resuspending the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash with 75% chilled ethanol. Avoid resuspending the pellet.

source_data.reagent_name: Ethyl alcohol, Pure 200 proof, for molecular biology

components.data: Discard supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant.

components.data: Centrifuge at 14.000 g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 14.000 g.

components.data: Repeat washing step with 75% chilled ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat washing step with 75% chilled ethanol.

components.data: Fill 50 mL Falcon tube with ice. Fill with bacterial liquid culture, up to a volume of ~45 mL.
components.name: Description

components.data: Discard supernatant. Resuspend cell pellet in residual water (~1 mL). Transfer to 2 mL 'safe lock' tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant. Resuspend cell pellet in residual water (~1 mL). Transfer to 2 mL 'safe lock' tube.

components.data:
In-vitro-transcription mixture:  
PCR product (0.1-1 µg)  14 µL 
T7-Flash 10x reaction buffer  2 µL 
DIG RNA labeling mix  2 µL
100 nM DTT  2 µL
RiboGuard RNase Inhibitor 0.5 µL
T7-Flash Enzyme Solution  2 µL 

 

Icubate at 37°C at least 2 h.

components.data:
Preparation of Semidry blotting sandwich:

 

  • Prepare the transfer buffer (1x TBE Buffer)
  • Cut the membrane to the dimensions of the gel. Wet the membrane in transfer buffer.
  • Cut filter paper ( 8 peaces of thick filter paper) to the dimensions of the gel. Wet filter paper in transfer buffer.
  • Place 4 of the pre-soaked sheets of thick filter paper onto the platinum anode. Roll a pipet or test tube over the surface of the filter paper to exclude all air bubbles.
  • Place the pre-wetted blotting media on top of the filter paper.
  • Carefully place the gel on top of the transfer membrane, aligning the gel on the center of the membrane.
  • Place the other pre-soaked sheets of  filter paper onto the gel. Exclude air bubbles as before.
  • Carefully place the cathode onto the stack.

Blot with 2 mA/ cm² membrane for 45 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Preparation of Semidry blotting sandwich:

 

  • Prepare the transfer buffer (1x TBE Buffer)
  • Cut the membrane to the dimensions of the gel. Wet the membrane in transfer buffer.
  • Cut filter paper ( 8 peaces of thick filter paper) to the dimensions of the gel. Wet filter paper in transfer buffer.
  • Place 4 of the pre-soaked sheets of thick filter paper onto the platinum anode. Roll a pipet or test tube over the surface of the filter paper to exclude all air bubbles.
  • Place the pre-wetted blotting media on top of the filter paper.
  • Carefully place the gel on top of the transfer membrane, aligning the gel on the center of the membrane.
  • Place the other pre-soaked sheets of  filter paper onto the gel. Exclude air bubbles as before.
  • Carefully place the cathode onto the stack.

Blot with 2 mA/ cm² membrane for 45 min.

components.data: UV-crosslink the wet membrane without prior washing. After crosslinking, membrane can be stored dry at +8°C to +25°C. If you want to go ahead use the membrane immediatley for prehybridization.
components.name: Description

components.name: Section

components.data:
• Prewarm DIG Easy Hyb solution to hybridization temperature (62° C).
  • Prehybridize membrane with RNA side facing inwards with DIG Easy Hyb for 30 min with gentle agigation in hybridization flask.

components.data:
It is recommended to prepare all needed buffers before start northern blotting.

 

List of Buffers:      
Solution Preparation Storage Use
DIG Easy Hyb Granules Reconstitue granules adding 64 mL DMPC treated water, dissolve by stirring at 37° C  at +15° C to 25° C for 1 month As prehybridization and hybridization solution
Washing buffer 0.1 M Maleic acid, 0.15 M NaCl; adjust with NaOH (solid) to pH 7.5 (20° C); 0.3% (v/v) Tween 20 at +15° C to 25° C stable Removal of unspecific bound antibody
Maleic acid buffer 0.1 M Maleic acid, 0.15 M NaCl; adjust with NaOH (solid) to pH 7.5 (20° C) at +15° C to 25° C stable Dilution of Blocking solution
Detection buffer 0.1 Tris-HCl, 0.1 M NaCl, adjustment of pH to 9.5 (20° C) at +15° C to 25° C stable Adjustment of pH to 9.5
Blocking solution Prepare a 10x stock solution at 8° C stable Blocking of unspecific binding sites on the membrane
components.name: Description

components.data: Prepartion of needed buffers
components.name: Section

components.data:
• Denature DIG-labeled RNA probe from Step 4 by boiling for 5 min and rapidly cooling in ice/water.
  • Add denatured DIG-labeled RNA probe to hybridization flask and incubate for 6 h or over night with gentle aggigation.

Hybridization is follwed by stringency washes:

  • Wash 2 x 5 min in 2x SSC,0.1% SDS at room temperature under constant aggigation.
  • Wash 2 x 15 min in 0.1x SSC,0.1% SDS at 62° C under constant aggigation.
components.name: Description
